intro: Sinapis cheiranthos var. sabulicola, commonly known as sand mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and has small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces small, triangular pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low moisture availability.
